description: Verruca Vulgaris, also known as the common wart, is a viral skin infection caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV). It typically appears as a small, rough bump on the skin and can be contagious.
possible causes: Direct contact with the virus through cuts or abrasions on the skin
Walking barefoot in public places where the virus may be present
symptoms: Small, rough bump on the skin
Black dots in the center of the wart
Pain or tenderness when pressure is applied
treatments: Over-the-counter wart treatments containing salicylic acid
Prescription medications or procedures from a healthcare provider
